summary_short: The Abroms-Engel Institute for Visual Arts is a vibrant hub for contemporary art in Birmingham, offering dynamic exhibitions and educational programs.
summary_long: The Abroms-Engel Institute for Visual Arts (AEIVA) serves as a dynamic center for contemporary art in Birmingham, Alabama. Designed by the renowned architect Randall Stout, AEIVA features three galleries, a lecture hall, and an atrium, providing a versatile space for art exhibitions and community engagement. The institute hosts seven to ten contemporary art exhibitions annually, including solo and thematic group shows, as well as an annual graduating BFA exhibition. AEIVA is committed to supporting cutting-edge exhibitions and educational programs, making it a vital part of the University of Alabama at Birmingham and the local community.
